name: Enrich Company Sales Data with Extruct AI and Export to Google Sheets

user.name: Extruct AI
user.bio: Turn natural language into structured company data with one API call. Skip the web scraping, HTML parsing, and data cleaning - just describe the companies you're looking for and get back verified, enriched results. Perfect for enriching CRMs, building lead generation workflows, or automating market research. Built by developers who understand that the best company data isn't trapped in static databases - it's live on the web.

description:
**Who‚Äôs it for:**  
Sales and business development professionals who want to monitor company news, hiring trends, and business signals for their leads.

**How it works / What it does:**  
Add a company to the form, and the workflow will automatically search for the latest news, recent hires, company stage, and LinkedIn activity. The results are sent straight to your Google Sheet, helping you stay up to date with your leads and prospects.

**How to set up:**  
1. Register for Extruct at [www.extruct.ai/](https://www.extruct.ai/).  
2. Open the Extruct table template, copy the table ID from the browser‚Äôs address bar.  
3. Make a copy of the Google Sheets template to your Drive.  
4. Enter the table ID into the variables node in your n8n flow.  
5. Set up Bearer authentication in all HTTP Request nodes using your Extruct API token.  
6. In the Google Sheets node, paste your template link and connect your Google account.  
7. Run the flow once to load the mapping fields, then match each output to the correct column.  
8. Activate the flow and start adding companies through the form.

**Requirements:**  
- Extruct account and API token  
- Extruct table template  
- Google account with Google Sheets

**How to customize the workflow:**  
To track more business development signals, add new columns in both the Extruct table and your Google Sheet, then map them in the Google Sheets node.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.formDescription: Enter the name or website of a company

parameters.content:
## Quickstart Guide for Sales & Business Development Dashboard

## 1. Create an Extruct account
- Sign-up link with 2,500 free credits: www.extruct.ai/

## 2. Prepare Your Tables
1) Open the Extruct table template using this link: https://app.extruct.ai/tables/shared/jlcBdFwKXrC8uw21
After the table loads, find the unique table ID in your browser‚Äôs address bar (it will be part of the URL).

![Screenshot](https://images.weserv.nl/?url=raw.githubusercontent.com/zodackwand/extruct_screenshots/main/table_id_from_link.png&w=500)

2) Paste this table ID into the variables block in your n8n flow.

3) Open the provided Google Sheets template: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Oi90qK9aK93lVaq8RpqXPIuIa8E_aGWkkcdCAWQaHBk/edit?usp=sharing
Make a copy of this template to your own Google Drive.

4) In the Google Sheets node, paste the link to your own copy of the Google Sheets template.
Make sure to connect your Google account in this node. If you haven‚Äôt connected it before, create a new Google Sheets credential in n8n.

---

## 3. Set Up Authorizations
- Bearer Token:
Make sure that each HTTP Request node in the n8n flow uses your personal Extruct API token for Bearer authentication. You can create and find your API token on the API page in the Extruct web app.

---

## 4. Match Output Columns in the Google Sheets Node
1) If you don‚Äôt have any input data in the Google Sheets node, run the flow once with a test form input.
(It‚Äôs normal if you get an error‚Äîthis step is just to load the input fields.)

2) After running the node, you‚Äôll see the input fields appear.
Now, drag each field from the input field to the matching column in your Google Sheet copy.

![Screenshot](https://images.weserv.nl/?url=raw.githubusercontent.com/zodackwand/extruct_screenshots/main/drag_input_to_columns.png&w=600)

Make sure that the "Column to match on" field is set to "Company name".

---

## 5. Activate the Flow
1) Switch your flow to Active mode in n8n.
2) Use the provided form (Production URL) to add new companies.
3) After Extruct processes the data, the enriched company information will automatically appear in your Google Sheets copy.

### If you have any questions, please reach out to us directly in the chat on the Extruct website - we‚Äôre happy to help!

## Extra Functionality: Adding Custom Columns
You can add your own columns to track additional information:
1) Add a new column in your Extruct web app table.
2) Add the same column to your copy of the Google Sheets template.
3) In the Google Sheets node in n8n, map the new field to the correct column in your

## Input:
- User submits a company via the form.
- Variables node sets up required parameters (Table ID).

## Enrichment:
The flow sends the company data for enrichment and waits until processing is complete.
It checks the status in a loop until the data is ready.

## Output:
Once enrichment is finished, the flow retrieves the results, formats them, and updates your Google Sheet.
